item.title: Programming with dplyr: Part 02, writing a function
item.description: Recently, since dplyr <= 0.6.0 a new way of dealing with NSE was introduced, called tidyeval. As with every topic that begs our attention, the question “why bother” is in place. Theone answer is “you’ll need this stuff if you want to lock dplyr verbs inside a function”. Once you like dplyr and friends, a natural second step is to use the ideas not only for interactive use, but for more “programming” type, ie., writing functions.
